Mons.DE B E R I O T
Respectfully informs the Nobility, Gentry,
and Public generally, that in consequence of
the performance of the German Opera at
Covent Garden; the Grand Concert, at the
King's Theatre; and the usual performances
at Vauxhall, on the same Evening; and the
consequent difficulty of providing an efficient
Band, he has

POSTPONED
HIS DRAMATIC

CONCERT
UNTIL

Wednesday Next- June 26,1833.
HH3' Those parties who have purchased
Tickets or Private Boxes, have the option of
receiving back their Money; or the Tickets
of the 21st will be admitted ou the 26th.
m* The BOX-OFFICE is open Daily from Ten until
Four.where P R I V A T E BOXES, STALLS, T I C K E T S
and P L A C E S , may be had of Mr. PARSONS, Box Book
Keeper.

Willi T H E CELEBRATED TRADITIONAL

The Properties and Decorations by Mr, W . B R A D W E I X .

will be produced the New Historical Comedy, in 5 Acts,

the Dress: at the same time, he begs leave respectfully to slate, that the coiitinuauce of this reduced
Scale of Adaiissioii will depeud entirely on an lucrease of Patronage from the Public.

FARCE

I s also in p r e p a r a t i o n , and will b eperformed in a few D a y s , in w h i c h Mr. V I N I N G , a n d

03" I t having been suggested to the Lessee of the National Theatres, that some reduction in the
Price of Admission to the Boxes would be acceptable to the Public, he has adopted it in the Circles above
I he Dress: at the same time, he begs leave respectfully to s a t e , that the continuauce of this reduced
Scale of Admission will depend entirely on an mcrease of Patronage from the Public.
The Prices of Admission therefore will be, Dress Circle, First Price 7s.—Second Price Ss. 6d.—
Upper Circles, First Price 5s. Second Price 3s.—Pit, First Price 3s. 6A. Second Price 2s.—Lower Gallery
2s. Second Price Is.—Upper Gallery Is Soeond Price 6d.
The Stalls will also be reduced to 7s.
The Entrance to :he Dress Circle will be from the right of the Rotunda in Brydges Street.
The Entrance to the Upper Circles will be from the left of the Rotunda, in Brydges Street.
The B O X - O F F I C E will be opened Daily, from Ten until Four o'Clock, under the superintendance of
Mr. PARSONS, Box-Book Keeper, where Tickets, Places, Private and Family Boxes, may be secured.
The Doors will be opened at Half-past

Six, and the Performances commence at Seven o'Clock precisely.

The Entrauce to the Upper Circles will be from the left of the Rotunda, in Brvdges Street.
The BOX-OFFICE will be opened Daily, from Teti until Four o'Clock, under the superiuttudauce ef
Mr. PARSONS, Box-Book Keeper, where Tickets. Places. Private and Family Boxes, may be secured.
The Doors will be opened aTJfaif^past Six^and the Performances commence at Seven o'Clock precisely

of the most eminent T r a g e d i a n s that has adorned t h e
S t a g e , he w i l l repeat the Character To-morrow,
and his Performance of R I C H A R D the T H I R D is
therefore deferred until Monday n e x t .

REGENT!
